intro: Cryptandra subtilis, commonly known as the slender cryptandra, is a small shrub native to the southern regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
